title: How to Change Address With Connecticut DMV

steps.headline: Indicate the options you need to change by checking the appropriate box or boxes--driver's license, registration for your motor vehicle, and/or registration for your boat.
Select whether or not you would like to be listed in the Organ Donor Registry.
Check whether you need to change your address to update your voter registration location.
List your name under Applicant 1--surname, first name, and your middle initial.
steps.description: If your spouse, domestic partner, or other person is changing his address, list his name under Applicant 2.

steps.headline: Write in your new mailing address.
steps.description: Include house or apartment number, street, city or town, state and zip code.

steps.headline: Include your new residential address if it is different than your new mailing address.
Determine the Connecticut town or city where your car will primarily reside, leave from and return.
steps.description: Fill it out to the right of the line that says "Tax Town."

steps.headline: Ensure that all applicants sign their signatures and date the form in the Signature section.
Fill in your Connecticut Operator's License Number in the spaces provided.
steps.description: If there is another applicant, fill in his Operator's License Number in the section next to yours.

steps.headline: Indicate your vehicle's state, registration number, and expiration date if necessary.
List all motor vehicles that require a change of address.
steps.description:
For each vehicle:
Write down the type of plate (passenger, camper, combination, etc.) Write down the number of each license plate
Include each license plate's expiration date

steps.headline: Mail the completed form to the Connecticut Department of Motor Vehicles.
steps.description: Refer to their website for the mailing address.

text:
Indicate the options you need to change by checking the appropriate box or boxes--driver's license, registration for your motor vehicle, and/or registration for your boat.  Select whether or not you would like to be listed in the Organ Donor Registry.  Check whether you need to change your address to update your voter registration location.  List your name under Applicant 1--surname, first name, and your middle initial. If your spouse, domestic partner, or other person is changing his address, list his name under Applicant 2. Write in your new mailing address. Include house or apartment number, street, city or town, state and zip code. Include your new residential address if it is different than your new mailing address.  Determine the Connecticut town or city where your car will primarily reside, leave from and return. Fill it out to the right of the line that says "Tax Town." Ensure that all applicants sign their signatures and date the form in the Signature section.  Fill in your Connecticut Operator's License Number in the spaces provided. If there is another applicant, fill in his Operator's License Number in the section next to yours. Indicate your vehicle's state, registration number, and expiration date if necessary.  List all motor vehicles that require a change of address. For each vehicle:
Write down the type of plate (passenger, camper, combination, etc.) Write down the number of each license plate
Include each license plate's expiration date Fill in your prior residence.  Mail the completed form to the Connecticut Department of Motor Vehicles. Refer to their website for the mailing address.
